content:
Charles F. Reynolds III, M.D., is a geriatric psychiatrist and academic researcher. He is well-known for his research in mood disorders, particularly among older adults. Dr. Reynolds served as a professor of Psychiatry, Neurology, Behavioral and Community Health Sciences, and Clinical and Translational Science at the University of Pittsburgh School of Medicine.

Dr. Reynolds has been recognized with numerous awards for his work, including the American College of Psychiatrists' Award for Research in Geriatric Psychiatry and the American Association for Geriatric Psychiatry's Distinguished Scientist Award. He has made significant contributions to the field of geriatric psychiatry, focusing on the treatment and prevention of mood disorders and sleep disorders in older adults.

Please note that the information provided might not be up to date as my knowledge is limited up to September 2021.
